\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00082}00082     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{! 1. introduction}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00083}00083     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00084}00084     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    quadpack is a fortran subroutine package for the numerical}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00085}00085     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    computation of definite one-\/dimensional integrals. it originated}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00086}00086     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    from a joint project of r. piessens and e. de doncker (appl.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00087}00087     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    math. and progr. div.-\/ k.u.leuven, belgium), c. ueberhuber (inst.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00088}00088     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    fuer math.-\/ techn.u.wien, austria), and d. kahaner (nation. bur.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00089}00089     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    of standards-\/ washington d.c., u.s.a.).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00090}00090     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00091}00091     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{! 2. survey}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00092}00092     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00093}00093     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qags : is an integrator based on globally adaptive interval}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00094}00094     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             subdivision in connection with extrapolation (de doncker,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00095}00095     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             1978) by the epsilon algorithm (wynn, 1956).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00096}00096     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00097}00097     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qagp : serves the same purposes as qags, but also allows}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00098}00098     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             for eventual user-\/supplied information, i.e. the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00099}00099     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             abscissae of internal singularities, discontinuities}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00100}00100     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             and other difficulties of the integrand function.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00101}00101     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             the algorithm is a modification of that in qags.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00102}00102     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00103}00103     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qagi : handles integration over infinite intervals. the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00104}00104     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             infinite range is mapped onto a finite interval and}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00105}00105     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             then the same strategy as in qags is applied.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00106}00106     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00107}00107     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qawo : is a routine for the integration of cos(omega*x)*f(x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00108}00108     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             or sin(omega*x)*f(x) over a finite interval (a,b).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00109}00109     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             omega is is specified by the user}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00110}00110     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             the rule evaluation component is based on the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00111}00111     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             modified clenshaw-\/curtis technique.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00112}00112     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             an adaptive subdivision scheme is used connected with}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00113}00113     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             an extrapolation procedure, which is a modification}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00114}00114     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             of that in qags and provides the possibility to deal}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00115}00115     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             even with singularities in f.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00116}00116     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00117}00117     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qawf : calculates the fourier cosine or fourier sine}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00118}00118     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             transform of f(x), for user-\/supplied interval (a,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00119}00119     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             infinity), omega, and f. the procedure of qawo is}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00120}00120     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             used on successive finite intervals, and convergence}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00121}00121     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             acceleration by means of the epsilon algorithm (wynn,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00122}00122     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             1956) is applied to the series of the integral}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00123}00123     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             contributions.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00124}00124     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00125}00125     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qaws : integrates w(x)*f(x) over (a,b) with a < b finite,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00126}00126     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             and   w(x) = ((x-\/a)**alfa)*((b-\/x)**beta)*v(x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00127}00127     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             where v(x) = 1 or log(x-\/a) or log(b-\/x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00128}00128     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                            or log(x-\/a)*log(b-\/x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00129}00129     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             and   -\/1 < alfa, -\/1 < beta.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00130}00130     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             the user specifies a, b, alfa, beta and the type of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00131}00131     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             the function v.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00132}00132     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             a globally adaptive subdivision strategy is applied,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00133}00133     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             with modified clenshaw-\/curtis integration on the}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00136}00136     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    -\/ qawc : computes the cauchy principal value of f(x)/(x-\/c)}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00139}00139     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             the strategy is globally adaptive, and modified}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00140}00140     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             clenshaw-\/curtis integration is used on the subranges}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00141}00141     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!             which contain the point x = c.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00142}00142     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00143}00143     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!  each of the routines above also has a "{}more detailed"{} version}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00144}00144     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    with a name ending in e, as qage.  these provide more}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00145}00145     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    information and control than the easier versions.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00146}00146     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00147}00147     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00148}00148     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!   the preceeding routines are all automatic.  that is, the user}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00149}00149     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      inputs his problem and an error tolerance.  the routine}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00150}00150     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      attempts to perform the integration to within the requested}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00151}00151     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      absolute or relative error.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00152}00152     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!   there are, in addition, a number of non-\/automatic integrators.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00153}00153     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      these are most useful when the problem is such that the}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00158}00158     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk15}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00159}00159     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk21}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00160}00160     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk31}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00161}00161     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk41}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00162}00162     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk51}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00163}00163     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk61}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00164}00164     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!           estimate the integral on [a,b] using 15, 21,..., 61}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00167}00167     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qk15w 15 point rule for special singular weight functions.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00170}00170     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      qmomo integrates k-\/th degree chebychev polynomial times}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00171}00171     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!            function with various explicit singularities.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00173}00173     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{! 3. guidelines for the use of quadpack}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00174}00174     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00175}00175     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    here it is not our purpose to investigate the question when}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00176}00176     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    automatic quadrature should be used. we shall rather attempt}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00177}00177     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    to help the user who already made the decision to use quadpack,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00178}00178     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    with selecting an appropriate routine or a combination of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00179}00179     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    several routines for handling his problem.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00180}00180     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00181}00181     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    for both quadrature over finite and over infinite intervals,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00182}00182     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    one of the first questions to be answered by the user is}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00183}00183     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    related to the amount of computer time he wants to spend,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00184}00184     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    versus his -\/own-\/ time which would be needed, for example, for}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00185}00185     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    manual subdivision of the interval or other analytic}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00186}00186     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    manipulations.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00187}00187     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00188}00188     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    (1) the user may not care about computer time, or not be}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00189}00189     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        willing to do any analysis of the problem. especially when}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00190}00190     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        only one or a few integrals must be calculated, this attitude}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00191}00191     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        can be perfectly reasonable. in this case it is clear that}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00192}00192     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        either the most sophisticated of the routines for finite}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00193}00193     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        intervals, qags, must be used, or its analogue for infinite}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00194}00194     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        intervals, qagi. these routines are able to cope with}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00195}00195     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        rather difficult, even with improper integrals.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00196}00196     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        this way of proceeding may be expensive. but the integrator}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00197}00197     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        is supposed to give you an answer in return, with additional}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00198}00198     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        information in the case of a failure, through its error}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00199}00199     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        estimate and flag. yet it must be stressed that the programs}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00200}00200     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        cannot be totally reliable.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00201}00201     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00202}00202     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    (2) the user may want to examine the integrand function.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00203}00203     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        if bad local difficulties occur, such as a discontinuity, a}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00204}00204     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        singularity, derivative singularity or high peak at one or}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00205}00205     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        more points within the interval, the first advice is to}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00206}00206     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        split up the interval at these points. the integrand must}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00207}00207     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        then be examinated over each of the subintervals separately,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00208}00208     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        so that a suitable integrator can be selected for each of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00209}00209     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        them. if this yields problems involving relative accuracies}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00210}00210     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        to be imposed on -\/finite-\/ subintervals, one can make use of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00211}00211     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        qagp, which must be provided with the positions of the local}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00212}00212     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        difficulties. however, if strong singularities are present}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00213}00213     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        and a high accuracy is requested, application of qags on the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00214}00214     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        subintervals may yield a better result.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00215}00215     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00216}00216     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        for quadrature over finite intervals we thus dispose of qags}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00217}00217     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        and}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00218}00218     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        -\/ qng for well-\/behaved integrands,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00219}00219     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        -\/ qag for functions with an oscillating behavior of a non}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00220}00220     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!          specific type,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00221}00221     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        -\/ qawo for functions, eventually singular, containing a}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00222}00222     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!          factor cos(omega*x) or sin(omega*x) where omega is known,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00223}00223     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        -\/ qaws for integrands with algebraico-\/logarithmic end point}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00224}00224     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!          singularities of known type,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00225}00225     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        -\/ qawc for cauchy principal values.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00226}00226     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00227}00227     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        remark}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00228}00228     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00229}00229     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        on return, the work arrays in the argument lists of the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00230}00230     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        adaptive integrators contain information about the interval}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00231}00231     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        subdivision process and hence about the integrand behavior:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00232}00232     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        the end points of the subintervals, the local integral}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00233}00233     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        contributions and error estimates, and eventually other}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00234}00234     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        characteristics. for this reason, and because of its simple}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00235}00235     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        globally adaptive nature, the routine qag in particular is}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00236}00236     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        well-\/suited for integrand examination. difficult spots can}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00237}00237     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        be located by investigating the error estimates on the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00238}00238     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        subintervals.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00239}00239     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00240}00240     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        for infinite intervals we provide only one general-\/purpose}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00241}00241     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        routine, qagi. it is based on the qags algorithm applied}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00242}00242     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        after a transformation of the original interval into (0,1).}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00243}00243     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        yet it may eventuate that another type of transformation is}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00244}00244     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        more appropriate, or one might prefer to break up the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00245}00245     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        original interval and use qagi only on the infinite part}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00246}00246     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        and so on. these kinds of actions suggest a combined use of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00247}00247     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        different quadpack integrators. note that, when the only}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00248}00248     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        difficulty is an integrand singularity at the finite}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00249}00249     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        integration limit, it will in general not be necessary to}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00250}00250     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        break up the interval, as qagi deals with several types of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00251}00251     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        singularity at the boundary point of the integration range.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00252}00252     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        it also handles slowly convergent improper integrals, on}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00253}00253     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        the condition that the integrand does not oscillate over}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00254}00254     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        the entire infinite interval. if it does we would advise}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00255}00255     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        to sum succeeding positive and negative contributions to}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00257}00257     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        or more of the finite-\/range integrators, and apply}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00258}00258     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        convergence acceleration eventually by means of quadpack}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00259}00259     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        subroutine qelg which implements the epsilon algorithm.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00260}00260     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        such quadrature problems include the fourier transform as}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00261}00261     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        a special case. yet for the latter we have an automatic}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00262}00262     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!        integrator available, qawf.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00263}00263     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l00264}00264 \textcolor{fortran_statement}{      return}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03862}03862     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Robert Piessens, Elise de Doncker-\/Kapenger, }}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03863}03863     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Christian Ueberhuber, David Kahaner,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03864}03864     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    QUADPACK, a Subroutine Package for Automatic Integration,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03865}03865     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Springer Verlag, 1983}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03866}03866     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03867}03867     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!  Parameters:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03868}03868     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03869}03869     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, external real(RK) F, the name of the function routine, of the form}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03870}03870     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      function f ( x )}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03871}03871     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      real(RK) f}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03872}03872     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!      real(RK) x}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03873}03873     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    which evaluates the integrand function.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03874}03874     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03875}03875     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, real(RK) A, B, the limits of integration.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03876}03876     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03877}03877     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, real(RK) ALFA, BETA, parameters used in the weight function.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03878}03878     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    ALFA and BETA should be greater than -\/1.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03879}03879     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03880}03880     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, integer(IK) INTEGR, indicates which weight function is used:}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03881}03881     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    = 1  (x-\/a)**alfa*(b-\/x)**beta}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03882}03882     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    = 2  (x-\/a)**alfa*(b-\/x)**beta*log(x-\/a)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03883}03883     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    = 3  (x-\/a)**alfa*(b-\/x)**beta*log(b-\/x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03884}03884     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    = 4  (x-\/a)**alfa*(b-\/x)**beta*log(x-\/a)*log(b-\/x)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03885}03885     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03886}03886     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, real(RK) EPSABS, EPSREL, the absolute and relative accuracy requested.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03887}03887     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03888}03888     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Input, integer(IK) LIMIT, an upper bound on the number of subintervals}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03889}03889     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    in the partition of (A,B), LIMIT >= 2.  If LIMIT < 2, the routine }}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03890}03890     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!     will end with IER = 6.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03891}03891     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03892}03892     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Output, real(RK) RESULT, the estimated value of the integral.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03893}03893     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03894}03894     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Output, real(RK) ABSERR, an estimate of || I -\/ RESULT ||.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03895}03895     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03896}03896     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Output, integer(IK) NEVAL, the number of times the integral was evaluated.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03897}03897     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03898}03898     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!            ier    -\/ integer(IK)}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03899}03899     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                     ier = 0 normal and reliable termination of the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03900}03900     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             routine. it is assumed that the requested}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03901}03901     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             accuracy has been achieved.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03902}03902     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                     ier > 0 abnormal termination of the routine}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03903}03903     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             the estimates for the integral and error}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03904}03904     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             are less reliable. it is assumed that the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03905}03905     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             requested accuracy has not been achieved.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03906}03906     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                         = 1 maximum number of subdivisions allowed}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03907}03907     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             has been achieved. one can allow more}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03908}03908     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             subdivisions by increasing the value of}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03909}03909     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             limit. however, if this yields no}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03910}03910     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             improvement it is advised to analyze the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03911}03911     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             integrand, in order to determine the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03912}03912     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             integration difficulties which prevent}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03913}03913     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             the requested tolerance from being}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03914}03914     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             achieved. in case of a jump discontinuity}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03915}03915     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             or a local singularity of algebraico-\/}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03916}03916     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             logarithmic type at one or more interior}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03917}03917     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             points of the integration range, one}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03918}03918     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             should proceed by splitting up the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03919}03919     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             interval at these points and calling the}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03920}03920     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             integrator on the subranges.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03921}03921     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                         = 2 the occurrence of roundoff error is}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03922}03922     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             detected, which prevents the requested}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03923}03923     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             tolerance from being achieved.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03924}03924     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                         = 3 extremely bad integrand behavior occurs}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03925}03925     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             at some points of the integration}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03926}03926     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             interval.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03927}03927     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                         = 6 the input is invalid, because}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03928}03928     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             b <= a or alfa <= (-\/1) or beta <= (-\/1) or}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03929}03929     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             integr < 1 or integr > 4, or}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03930}03930     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             epsabs < 0 and epsrel < 0,}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03931}03931     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             or limit < 2.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03932}03932     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             result, abserr, neval, rlist(1), elist(1),}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03933}03933     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             iord(1) and last are set to zero.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03934}03934     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             alist(1) and blist(1) are set to a and b}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03935}03935     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!                             respectively.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03936}03936     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03937}03937     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Workspace, real(RK) ALIST(LIMIT), BLIST(LIMIT), contains in entries 1 }}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03938}03938     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    through LAST the left and right ends of the partition subintervals.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03939}03939     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03940}03940     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Workspace, real(RK) RLIST(LIMIT), contains in entries 1 through LAST}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03941}03941     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    the integral approximations on the subintervals.}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03942}03942     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03943}03943     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    Workspace, real(RK) ELIST(LIMIT), contains in entries 1 through LAST}}
\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03944}03944     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!    the absolute error estimates on the subintervals.}}

\DoxyCodeLine{\Hypertarget{QuadPackRK32__mod_8f90_source_l03946}03946     \textcolor{fortran_comment}{!            iord   -\/ integer(IK)}}
